Package com.intellij.openapi.keymap.impl

Class IdeMouseEventDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.keymap.impl.IdeMouseEventDispatcher

  • public final class IdeMouseEventDispatcher
extends java.lang.Object
    Current implementation of the dispatcher is intended to filter mouse event addressed to the editor. Also it allows to map middle mouse's button to some action.

      • forbidForceTouch

        public static void forbidForceTouch()

      • isForceTouchAllowed

        public static boolean isForceTouchAllowed()

      • dispatchMouseEvent

        public boolean dispatchMouseEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Returns:
        true if and only if the passed event is already dispatched by the IdeMouseEventDispatcher and there is no need for any other processing of the event. If the method returns false then it means that the event should be delivered to normal event dispatching.

      • patchClickCount

        public static boolean patchClickCount(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        This method patches event if it concerns side buttons like 4 (Backward) or 5 (Forward) AND it's not single-click event. We won't support double-click for side buttons. Also some JDK bugs produce zero-click events for side buttons.
        Returns:
        true if event was patched
